channel.title: Windows Vista
channel.description: Hi do you think windows vista is good or bad?? i think bad because nothing realy has been made for it e.g photoshop

item.title: Windows Vista
item.dc:creator: @iamafisher iamafisher
item.description:
@iamafisher wrote:

[quote=“Rictoo, post:17, topic:60295”][quote author=skyline3690 link=topic=86818.msg924659#msg924659 date=1172054277]
i reckon vista is good. Ive got a bit below average computer, a 3.06 Ghz processor (celeron D), 256 megabyte graphics card, 1 Gig RAM, 2x 40 Gig hard drives. And i have no problems with it, its almost as fast as xp was when it was on this computer. Although i havent run anything which requires a lot of resources. But i reckon its awesome
[/quote]
The only thing below average are your HDDs, but other than that you have a really nice setup.

I don’t feel like arguing about Vista right now, since it’s a little late here. Three words: Vista is Pointless. (MS is just releasing crap to make more money, since like noone is buying XP’s anymore because everyone has it).

Btw, there are about 15 topics about Windows Vista, please look before you post :P[/quote]

no rictoo, celeron smells.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows Vista
item.dc:creator: @juju juju
item.description:
@juju wrote:

moparisthebest:

Correct me if I am wrong, but programs for previous versions of windows also work on vista(for the most part) right? Certainly one would think photoshop would…

Not all programs do. There is a thing on microsoft.com that scans your system and lists applications that will run on vista iirc.

Freedom wise(as in the i-own-my-hardware-so-i-should-be-able-to-do-what-i-want-with-it-and-i-dont-want-to-be-spied-on-by-some-company-or-movie-producers kind of freedom), it’s not good at all.

But I guess if you want a more(to be seen?) secure system than XP with a nice interface that’s much more of a pain to use because of those damn UAC popups then you could use Vista.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows Vista
item.dc:creator: @Falko222 Falko222
item.description:
@Falko222 wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:6, topic:60295”][quote author=DeadBird link=topic=86818.msg923066#msg923066 date=1172029962]
It’s good if you have plenty of RAM (2 gig isn’t enough) and a dual-core processor.
Decent gfx card for the decent eye candy too.
So, no, unless you have money to throw around.
(Parts will get cheaper, as they did with XP\Windows 2000’s release)
[/quote]

I’m sticking with my xp-laptop.

Better yet, I can just switch to linux when xp comes obsolete.[/quote]

Xp became obsolete the moment it was released xD

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Wildfire Wildfire
item.description:

It does…I got Vista, it works fine (When I can actually learn to use PS :O)

item.title: Windows Vista
item.dc:creator: @YourDistracted YourDistracted
item.description:
@YourDistracted wrote:

error.login:

Hi do you think windows vista is good or bad?? i think bad because nothing really has been made for it e.g photoshop

That doesn’t make the OS bad just because programs aren’t made for it. Moron. Imagine having to code for a brand new OS. Would you start straightaway? No. Espically if it was a big program like photoshop. I think it will be great by the way. And so do all my IT friends.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows Vista
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

skyline3690:

i reckon vista is good. Ive got a bit below average computer, a 3.06 Ghz processor (celeron D), 256 megabyte graphics card, 1 Gig RAM, 2x 40 Gig hard drives. And i have no problems with it, its almost as fast as xp was when it was on this computer. Although i havent run anything which requires a lot of resources. But i reckon its awesome

The only thing below average are your HDDs, but other than that you have a really nice setup.

I don’t feel like arguing about Vista right now, since it’s a little late here. Three words: Vista is Pointless. (MS is just releasing crap to make more money, since like noone is buying XP’s anymore because everyone has it).

Btw, there are about 15 topics about Windows Vista, please look before you post

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:14, topic:60295”]Vista is like one of those high-end games, it takes exponentially more to get the next one up, but once you have it, you have it.

So I say bad. I hate those high end games.[/quote]
Crysis > Vista

item.title: Windows Vista
item.dc:creator: @DeadBird DeadBird
item.description:
@DeadBird wrote:

[quote=“moparisthebest, post:11, topic:60295”][quote author=DeadBird link=topic=86818.msg923066#msg923066 date=1172029962]
It’s good if you have plenty of RAM (2 gig isn’t enough) and a dual-core processor.
Decent gfx card for the decent eye candy too.
So, no, unless you have money to throw around.
(Parts will get cheaper, as they did with XP\Windows 2000’s release)
[/quote]

Windows Vista is running fine on my cousin’s computer that has 512mb of RAM and an AMD Athlon 2200+, 8mb AGP video card…[/quote]
Depends what your definition of fine is.

item.title: Windows Vista
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“usernamelol, post:9, topic:60295”][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=86818.msg923224#msg923224 date=1172031108]
I just don’t think there’s anything special to vista.

Ok, it looks good. But don’t forget, it has ridiculous specs to run it. Wow, no viruses, just wait, in a year or 2 when standard pcs will be sold with vista there probably will be viruses.

Now, I’m sure there’s a lot more to do with viruses than what I know, so I’ll try not to make myself an idiot, but in my opinion there will always be viruses for the most successful operating system. (Some can argue, especially people who use macs/linux)
[/quote]
They already make comps with vista ready nigga[/quote]

I know that, but when I mean 50%+ people with windows pc’s use vista.

Read full topic
